page.title: 01BOSTON WEST SCHOOL-LOCATION
page.content: {Boston}is a small{port}in{south-east {Lincolnshire.}It trades via the{River {Witham}and the{Wash}with the countries of{Europe and Scandinavia.}The land around it is{low and flat,}usually from 0-3 metres above sea level except for some man-made features. This type of land is known as{fenland.}The school lies on the{western outskirts of Boston with the town on one side and fields on the other. A feature of the landscape is the{lack of trees and {hedgerows.}Most buildings have trees as a windbreak and the edges of the fields are{drainage ditches}known locally as{drains or dykes.}The town is famous for its connection with the {Pilgrim Fathers,}the early settlement of{North America}and its magnificent parish chuch of{St. Botolph,}known as the{"Stump".
